theme: Micro, Small and Medium Enterprise support

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Private Small and Medium Enterprise
            (SME) Project in Nigeria. The overall objective of the
            project were to: (a) support existing enterprises to
            restructure and modernize their operations to maintain
            comparative advantage and regain competitive advantage; (b)
            help establish a new generation of viable investments in
            private productive sectors and service activities; and (c)
            improve the quality and range of financial and extension
            services available to SMEs. Bank's performance was
            satisfactory. Borrower's performance was deficient. The
            key lessons learned were as follows: (i) in order for
            market-based SME development to take place, Nigeria must
            achieve economic stability; (ii) the project had too many
            components in addition to the line-of-credit which already
            was a challenge for the Borrower since it involved
            channeling funds through twenty eight banks instead of one
            as in past projects; and (iii) the set-up of an apex unit
            with adequate operational facilities should be a condition
            of effectiveness for any future project to avoid the
            deficiencies experienced in this project.
